Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE
Name: Cup
Description: Cup with wide mouth and flared rim, set off from the body. Globular body with curved walls and stable base with flat bottom. It has a small handle, lobate in cross-section, which starts at the rim and ends in the upper third of the body. Pink-coloured paste. The upper two thirds of the exterior surface are covered with a reddish coating which is partially lost.
